Summary Harry is the Senior Engineering Manager for the Yahoo! Sports Editorial and Fantasy platform teams. Yahoo! Sports generates $150M in revenue and for the last three years is the busiest Sports Website on earth with projects like the Olympics generating over three billion page views in a few weeks.  
 
Harry is responsible for all engineering development, design and daily deployment of our software in an automated fashion using Continuous Integration. Loads in excess of 20,000rps are normal operations during busy periods and the techniques and systems used to deliver our pages and services with low latency are state of the art.  
 
Harry’s team are the best in the industry and Harry has a brilliant track record in, motivating, hiring and growing highly technical people. 
 
Specialities: Technical Management and leadership, Platform Solutions and Architecture, developing relationships and working with people to see them meet their potential. Agile methodologies. Summary Tenured career in Project & Event Management, and Continual Service Improvement, with over 7 years of proven success and leadership in the IT & Service Engineering industries. I am experienced in managing enterprise software implementations using Agile & ITIL methodologies. Certified Scrum Master and in Disaster Recovery & Business Continuity Management. I am currently pursuing CAPM & PMP certifications. Experience Sr. Project/Program Manager - Yahoo Search Products Yahoo April 2015  – Present (5 months) Sunnyvale, California Currently project managing product portfolio and service delivery for the Yahoo Search organization. Project Manager Yahoo May 2013  –  March 2015  (1 year 11 months) Sunnyvale, California I am currently managing software implementation projects to improve efficiencies for Production Operation employees. Using Agile methodologies, I am partnering alongside Engineers & Developers to deploy a machine learning solution which manages alert volume with the goals of decreasing time to detect and resolving events at a faster rate. I am also driving a project to implement an enterprise application to track & measure business continuity planning tests and results. Program Manager - Help Desk Institute (HDI) HDI Silicon Valley September 2008  –  March 2014  (5 years 7 months) Silicon Valley HDI Silicon Valley is a non-profit chapter of the HDI national organization; an industry leader in the distribution of IT best practices. As the VP of Program Management, I work with key contacts to facilitate meetings & events for IT professionals to come together to discuss common industry challenges, share ideas and build a network of contacts. Through connecting with the HDI organization, IT professionals can be connected with a wide array of career advancing opportunities across the Silicon Valley area, resulting in measurable career development. Outside of monthly Chapter IT meetings, other events I organize within SVHDI consist of Job Fairs, Resume & Interview workshops, Student meetings and key initiatives that benefit the communities of Silicon Valley. Business Operations Manager - Production Operations Yahoo! February 2011  –  May 2013  (2 years 4 months) Sunnyvale, CA Led cross functional team efforts towards implementing industry standard best practices, with the goal of improving operational maturity levels from a reactive model to a place of optimal business partnership. Using SMART goal planning, I was tasked with moving company application & server monitoring alerts to a centralized team (Tier 1), while identifying automation & self healing opportunities to reduce repetitive incidents. Documenting service management lifecycle proposals, I coordinated with vendor selection committees to review ITSM solutions, which resulted in the removal of fragmented tools & processes. The program provided significant cost savings and gave ompany engineers increased capacity to spend time on innovating for the future. Service Delivery Manager Yahoo! February 2011  –  February 2012  (1 year 1 month) Santa Clara, CA In February 2011, I co-founded and successfully launched a Quality of Service team, which was based on ITIL v3 continual service improvement best practices. After outlining the team vision and methodology, I mentored a talented and diverse group of specialists across IT operations, who were focused on a wide array of globally focused initiatives. Through the implementation the Quality of Service team, we were able to centralize the management of process improvement initiatives across Employee Support, increasing capacity across support teams, introducing transparency and removing duplication of work. Using SMART goal planning, I trained the specialists how to incorporate proven industry standard best practices into the management of initiatives, which led to the successful completion of multiple outstanding projects. Business Operations Manager - IT Yahoo December 2009  –  February 2011  (1 year 3 months) Santa Clara, California Measured the return on investment for all projects managed across the employee support organization, presenting highlights, identifying obstacles and developing quarterly business strategies. Led an industry standard maturity assessment, which allowed for focused operational improvement plans to be devised and executed upon. Coordinated quarterly and annual OPEX and CAPEX financial planning, leading executive initiatives to identify headcount spend year over year, as well as reviewing software & hardware costs to eliminate unnecessary maintenance, professional service and licensing costs. Global IT Relations Lead Yahoo! October 2008  –  December 2009  (1 year 3 months) Santa Clara, CA Partnered with Regional IT Managers across business units in Europe, India and Asia to standardize operational procedures with the goal of offering consistent service delivery levels 24/7. Some efforts consisted of implementing Live Chat, allowing for bilingual support, introducing marketing campaigns to drive service requests from Tier 2 to Tier 1 and assisting with the M&A for Maktoob, which is the Middle East largest internet search company. Working closely with Managers, concentrated efforts centered around socializing and driving support requests to a Global Service Desk team, using streamlined processes, reducing operational costs and increasing the capacity of Tier 2 teams. Global Service Desk Supervisor Yahoo! April 2007  –  October 2008  (1 year 7 months) Manhattan, NY Managed Global Service Desk Support Technicians Onsite, Remotely and Internationally, delivering on aggressive goals to achieve 90% FCR, Largely focusing on continual and sustainable service improvement, I partnered with regional support supervisors and senior management to introduce industry best practices, mature processes and streamline workflow efficiencies.	Incorporated India region into Service Desk, consolidating IT support under a single Global Service Desk and assisted in the introduction of targeted SLA's, which allowed for accurate performance baselines. Service Desk Technician Sony Music Entertainment July 2006  –  April 2007  (10 months) Manhattan, NY Provided quality and timely technical support to entertainment teams. I worked in the capacity as a Service Desk Technician, troubleshooting connectivity issues, off the shelf & proprietary applications, PDA’s and Exchange problems. While largely working to resolve service requests and incidents, I also assisted in the introduction of industry standard operating best practices, implementing a knowledge database & documenting operational procedures, workflows and training material. Service Desk Technician Pfizer Pharmaceuticals April 2006  –  June 2006  (3 months) Parsippany, NJ Provided quality and timely technical support to pharmaceutical teams. I worked in the capacity as a Service Desk Technician, troubleshooting connectivity issues, off the shelf & proprietary applications, PDA’s and Exchange problems. While largely working to resolve service requests and incidents, I also assisted with performing root cause analysis, providing workarounds and identifying long term solutions - often leading to incident reduction. Technical Account Supervisor C3i January 2003  –  October 2005  (2 years 10 months) Morristown, NY Supervised technical support teams based on SLA's with Johnson & Johnson (Vistakon), ensuring consistent service delivery, timely problem resolution, and quality customer satisfaction. I consistently performed trend/root cause analysis to identify common issues reported to the Service Desk, with the goals of reducing repetitive incidents and identifying accurate knowledge, for support teams. Partnered with training department to deliver industry standard customer service best practices and required technical operational & escalation procedures, which were measured through monthly assessments. Junior Business Analyst JDS Uniphase April 2000  –  June 2002  (2 years 3 months) Asbury, NJ Deployed Oracle Customer Relationship Management software throughout the the Sales Force. Partnering closely with Oracle consultants, I drove data conversion efforts - moving the Sales department from a flat file system, assisted consultants in the configuration of back-end applications and documented User Acceptance Testing requirements & results. I also performed post deployment validation, managed Tier 1 application support and provided reporting.
